Message.Title: Signed on to Tumblr, Couldn't Find Porn
Message.Msg: Long Yahoo, but have a friend/Yahoo owner who expressed concerned about all the Tumblr porn talk. So, I signed on to see if this was obvious. Spent 30 minutes going through many of the blog categories, Art, Photograpy, etc, etc. Opened up many of them figuring perhaps there were nudy pic buried in them, never saw any. Also, saw no category labeled porn. Perhaps, I didn't look in the right places, but certainly this is not an obvious porn site. Perhaps, it's buried in a sub-category, gender oriented, but I'm not worried about it anymore. Fiend decided it was ok too.

Topic.Title: Signed on to Tumblr, Couldn't Find Porn

Message.Msg: Good to know I'm not the only one who didn't see porn at all. Like a previous poster said, you have to type in specific porn-relevant search terms. I agree, it is not an issue - never was. Seems like your Tumblr experience is what you as an individual wants it to be. If you're searching for port it's there, but if you're not looking for that experience, it doesn't hit you in the face - so to speak (~~,

Topic.Title: Signed on to Tumblr, Couldn't Find Porn

Message.Msg: LOL - 'porn' not 'port' - although I guess if you're searching for port it's there as well.

Topic.Title: Yikes!! YHOO chart setup looks like setting up for a plunge! Formed a bearish hanging man bar.

Topic.Title: Yikes!! YHOO chart setup looks like setting up for a plunge! Formed a bearish hanging man bar.

Message.Msg: He's confused, it is a doji (on Thursday - means not sure where to go) followed by outside bullish day (Friday, means it is about to go and test the highs)... this is 80% chance, the other 20% depends on the market overall, if it is a huge bearish week ( Asia and EU don't roll over on Monday and Tuesday), then will not work. If market keeps going higher then we are going to test the 29s...

Topic.Title: Where is Yahoo News on Islamic Terrorist in London?

Message.Msg: Not true. Islam did not exist in the time of Abraham. The prophet Mohammed introduced Islam several hundred years after Jesus was on earth. Also, Christians believe that the God of the Old Testament loved mankind so much, that he sent His very own Son to die on the Cross to save men from the terrible fate that we so deserve. We believe that God is NOT a vengeful God, but a God of love who Loves ALL people. God loves Muslims greatly and desires that they come to know His Son as their Savior. Read the New Testament of the Bible and you will find this to be true. Read the Old Testament and you will see a patient God not willing to do harm, but always waiting for people to repent. It was only the lack of repentance and persistent sinfulness in the people of the Old Testament that led to God deliver punishment. That is NOT His desire. I wish you, and all of your brothers, and all on this message board a great day!

Topic.Title: It is a joke, that Tumbrl has the 27-fold price and Yelp the 50-fold market-cap of Local Corp, but both less US-Monthly-Unique-Visitors (newest numbers from Siteanalytics)
